body_html: I find that training mobile v2 is much slow than mobilenet v1 on tensorflow, about 50% fps. Then main difference between the two versions is that latter has much larger depthwise_conv layers. But the training time on Pytorch is reduced. These problems are also reported in https://www.zhihu.com/question/265709710. So I think the overhead occurs in tensorflow rather than CUDA.
